text: Which ADA title governs employment practices?
explanation: ADA Title I covers employment practices for private employers with 15 or more employees, state and local governments, employment agencies, and labor unions.

text: Which ADA title applies to state and local government programs and services?
explanation: ADA Title II applies to state and local governments, requiring that all programs, services, and activities be accessible to people with disabilities.

text: Which ADA title governs public accommodations such as restaurants, hotels, and retail stores?
explanation: ADA Title III covers private places of public accommodation, including restaurants, hotels, theaters, retail stores, and professional offices.

text: Which ADA title addresses telecommunications relay services for individuals with hearing or speech disabilities?
explanation: ADA Title IV addresses telecommunications relay services and requires telephone and internet companies to provide relay services for individuals with hearing or speech disabilities.

text: Which ADA title contains miscellaneous provisions, including anti-retaliation protections?
explanation: ADA Title V contains miscellaneous provisions, including protections against retaliation and coercion for individuals asserting their rights under the ADA.

text: Which part of the California Building Code addresses accessibility provisions for public accommodations, commercial facilities, and public housing?
explanation: CBC Chapter 11B applies to accessibility in public accommodations, commercial facilities, and public housing, aligning with the ADA.

text: Which CBC chapter applies to the design and construction of accessible dwelling units in privately funded multifamily housing?
explanation: CBC Chapter 11A applies to privately funded multifamily dwelling units, covering accessibility features in housing developments.

text: Which code provides alternative accessibility provisions for qualified historic buildings in California?
explanation: The California Historical Building Code (CHBC) provides alternative methods for achieving accessibility in qualified historic buildings while preserving their historic character.

text: The FHA design and construction requirements apply to which residential buildings?

choices.C: New multifamily buildings with 4+ units and first occupancy after 1991

explanation: FHA design and construction requirements apply to covered multifamily dwellings with 4 or more units, first occupied after March 13, 1991.

text: A privately-owned apartment complex leasing office open to the public is governed by which accessibility regimes?

choices.C: Both ADA Title III and FHA

explanation: The leasing office is a place of public accommodation (ADA Title III) while the dwelling units are covered by FHA.

text: Which California statute triggers accessibility in public accommodations and commercial facilities regardless of cost?
explanation: Health & Safety Code §19955 requires accessibility in public accommodations and commercial facilities when constructed or altered in California.

text: Under CBC 11B, which work is considered an alteration?

choices.D: Minor repairs with no impact on usability

explanation: Reconfiguring walls and doorways is an alteration under CBC 11B because it affects usability of the facility.

text: When does an alteration project in California trigger path of travel upgrades under CBC 11B-202.4?

choices.B: When the project cost exceeds the valuation threshold and affects a primary function area
choices.C: Only when new construction is added
choices.D: Never, path of travel is exempt

explanation: CBC 11B-202.4 requires path of travel upgrades when alterations affect a primary function area and the project cost exceeds the valuation threshold.

text: Under CBC 11B, what is the maximum percentage of construction costs that must be spent on path of travel upgrades when disproportionality applies?
explanation: CBC 11B-202.4 requires up to 20% of the project cost be spent on path of travel upgrades when disproportionality applies.

text: Which concept describes required removal of architectural barriers in existing facilities under ADA Title III?
explanation: ADA Title III requires readily achievable barrier removal in existing facilities, even without alterations.

text: What is the maximum running slope for an accessible route that is not considered a ramp under CBC/ADA standards?
explanation: Slopes steeper than 1:20 must be treated as ramps with additional requirements; 1:20 or less is an accessible route.

text: What is the maximum running slope for new construction ramps under ADA/CBC?
explanation: The maximum running slope for new construction ramps is 1:12; steeper slopes are not allowed except in limited existing site constraints.

text: What is the minimum clear width required at a swinging door in an accessible route?
explanation: Accessible doors must provide at least 32 inches of clear width measured from the face of the door to the stop with the door open 90 degrees.

text: Door hardware operable parts on accessible doors must be mounted between what heights above the finished floor?
explanation: Operable parts of door hardware must be between 34 inches and 48 inches above the finished floor.

text: What is the minimum width required for an access aisle serving a standard (non-van) accessible parking space under CBC?
explanation: Standard accessible parking spaces require an adjacent access aisle at least 60 inches wide.

text: What is the minimum width required for a van-accessible parking space under CBC?

choices.B: 132 inches with 60-inch aisle or 96 inches with 96-inch aisle

explanation: Van spaces may be 132 inches wide with a 60-inch aisle or 96 inches wide with a 96-inch aisle.

text: In California, what is the required minimum height to the bottom of an accessible parking identification sign mounted on a post?
explanation: California requires the bottom of accessible parking signs mounted on a post to be at least 72 inches above the finished grade.

text: Which statement about tow-away signage for accessible parking in California is TRUE?

choices.B: Tow-away signs are required and must include the telephone number of the law enforcement agency
choices.C: Tow-away signs are only required for van spaces
choices.D: Tow-away signs are required only in state facilities

explanation: California requires tow-away signage with specific language including the telephone number of the local law enforcement agency.

text: A federal post office altered in 2023 must comply with which law?
explanation: Post office facilities designed, constructed, or altered for the federal government are covered by the Architectural Barriers Act rather than the ADA or FHA.

text: Under FHA, which units are covered in non-elevator multifamily buildings with 4 or more units?
explanation: For non-elevator buildings with four or more units, the FHA design and construction requirements apply to all ground-floor dwelling units.

text: Which law requires auxiliary aids in public accommodations unless doing so would fundamentally alter the goods or services?
explanation: ADA Title III requires public accommodations to provide auxiliary aids and services unless doing so would fundamentally alter the nature of the goods or services offered.

text: A county builds new homeless shelters with both county and HUD funds. Which regimes apply?
explanation: Because the project is covered multifamily housing and receives federal financial assistance, FHA applies based on occupancy and Section 504 with UFAS applies due to federal funding.

text: Which law prohibits retaliation against individuals asserting disability rights?
explanation: ADA Title V contains the anti-retaliation and anti-coercion provisions protecting individuals who assert their rights under the ADA.

text: Which statute governs accessibility requirements in buildings built with state, county, or municipal funds in California?
explanation: Government Code §4450 requires that buildings, structures, sidewalks, curbs, and related facilities built with state, county, or municipal funds be accessible.

text: A private university leasing office in California is governed by which ADA title?
explanation: A private university leasing office open to the public is a place of public accommodation and therefore falls under ADA Title III.

text: FHA requires environmental controls such as thermostats to be mounted at or below what height?
explanation: Under the FHA design and construction requirements, environmental controls in covered dwelling units must generally be within a maximum of 48 inches above the finished floor to be reachable.

text: Which standard governs communication feature unit scoping in HUD-assisted housing?
explanation: HUD’s Section 504 regulations reference UFAS for scoping of communication feature units, including the 2 percent minimum for communication-accessible units.

text: For ABA facilities, which agencies issue enforceable standards?
explanation: Under the Architectural Barriers Act, the General Services Administration, Department of Defense, U.S. Postal Service, and HUD issue the enforceable accessibility standards for covered facilities.

text: Which ADA title governs employment practices?
explanation: ADA Title I is the employment title and prohibits discrimination in all aspects of employment for qualified individuals with disabilities.

text: Which California code permits equivalent facilitation for historic dwellings where strict compliance would threaten historic significance?
explanation: The California Historical Building Code allows equivalent facilitation methods where full compliance would threaten the historical significance of a qualified building.
